title: Awesome List Updates on Jun 10, 2020

items.title: Awesome Engineering Team Management
items.content_text:
### Engineering to Management Transition

*   [Advice to New Managers: Don't Joke About Firing People](https://staysaasy.com/engineering/2020/06/09/Don%27t-Joke.html) - ‚ÄúThe second you became their manager you forfeited the right to joke around in any capacity about their employment at the company.‚Äù
items.content_html:
Engineering to Management Transition

  • Advice to New Managers: Don't Joke About Firing People - ‚ÄúThe second you became their manager you forfeited the right to joke around in any capacity about their employment at the company.‚Äù

items.title: Awesome Ebpf
items.content_text:
### Reference Documentation / Kernel Documentation

*   [linux/Documentation/networking/filter.rst](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/Documentation/networking/filter.rst) - eBPF specification (somewhat outdated; information should still be valid, but not exhaustive).
items.content_html:
Reference Documentation / Kernel Documentation

  • linux/Documentation/networking/filter.rst - eBPF specification (somewhat outdated; information should still be valid, but not exhaustive).

items.title: ALL About RSS
items.content_text:
### RSS Extensions / Outline Processor Markup Language

*   [Media RSS Specification](https://www.rssboard.org/media-rss)
*   [GeoRSS](http://www.georss.org/) <sup>[657](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/657)</sup>

### specifically from (*a certain platform*) / SoundCloud

*   [GetRSSfeed](http://getrssfeed.com/) <sup>[656](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/656)</sup>

### RSS Editor / Docsify

*   [RSSme](http://www.amlpages.com/rssme.shtml) <sup>[649](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/649)</sup> ![Freeware](https://github.com/AboutRSS/ALL-about-RSS/raw/master/media/icons8-one-free-16.png)

### RSS2WIDGET / For website

*   [MOONMOON](https://moonmoon.org/) <sup>[648](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/648)</sup> [![Open-Source Software](https://github.com/AboutRSS/ALL-about-RSS/raw/master/media/open-source.png)](https://github.com/moonmoon/moonmoon)
*   [TINT](https://www.tintup.com/blog/the-best-rss-widget/) <sup>[652](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/652)</sup>

### Feed item filtering / Webpage Monitor Services with capability of monitoring RSS Feed [1264](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/1264)

*   [RSSFilter](https://rssfilter.netlify.app/) <sup>[655](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/655)</sup> [![Open-Source Software](https://github.com/AboutRSS/ALL-about-RSS/raw/master/media/open-source.png)](https://github.com/bcongdon/rssfilter)

### ü¶æ Others / Crypto or Blockchain relevant

*   [Mapnews.io](https://mapnews.io/) <sup>[657](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/657)</sup> : Today's News on a Map [![Open-Source Software](https://github.com/AboutRSS/ALL-about-RSS/raw/master/media/open-source.png)](https://github.com/TristanMenzinger/Mapnews)
items.content_html:
RSS Extensions / Outline Processor Markup Language

  • Media RSS Specification
  • GeoRSS 657

specifically from (a certain platform) / SoundCloud

  • GetRSSfeed 656

RSS Editor / Docsify

  • RSSme 649

RSS2WIDGET / For website

  • MOONMOON 648
  • TINT 652

Feed item filtering / Webpage Monitor Services with capability of monitoring RSS Feed 1264

  • RSSFilter 655

ü¶æ Others / Crypto or Blockchain relevant

  • Mapnews.io 657 : Today's News on a Map

items.title: Awesome Crystal
items.content_text:
### Dependency Injection

*   [Athena Dependency Injection (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/athena-framework/dependency-injection) - Robust dependency injection service container framework

### Framework Components

*   [Athena Event Dispatcher (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/athena-framework/event-dispatcher) - A Mediator and Observer pattern event library

### Web Frameworks

*   [Athena (‚≠ê219)](https://github.com/athena-framework/athena) - A web framework comprised of reusable, independent components
items.content_html:

Web Frameworks

items.title: Awesome Elixir
items.content_text:
### Books

*   [Programming Elixir 1.6](https://pragprog.com/titles/elixir16/) - The book provides introduction to functional and concurrent programming with Elixir by Dave Thomas (2014).
*   [Programming Phoenix 1.4](https://pragprog.com/titles/phoenix14/) - Definitive guide to build web applications with the Phoenix framework by Chris McCord, Jos√© Valim and Bruce Tate (2015).
items.content_html:
Books

  • Programming Elixir 1.6 - The book provides introduction to functional and concurrent programming with Elixir by Dave Thomas (2014).
  • Programming Phoenix 1.4 - Definitive guide to build web applications with the Phoenix framework by Chris McCord, Jos√© Valim and Bruce Tate (2015).

items.title: Awesome Robotic Tooling
items.content_text:
### Documentation and Presentation

*   [Reveal-Hugo (‚≠ê720)](https://github.com/dzello/reveal-hugo) - A Hugo theme for Reveal.js that makes authoring and customization a breeze. With it, you can turn any properly-formatted Hugo content into a HTML presentation.
*   [Hugo-Webslides (‚≠ê131)](https://github.com/RCJacH/hugo-webslides) - This is a Hugo template to create WebSlides presentation using markdown.

### Requirements and Safety

*   [awesome-safety-critical (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/stanislaw/awesome-safety-critical) - List of resources about programming practices for writing safety-critical software.

### Frameworks and Stacks

*   [awesome-ros2 (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/fkromer/awesome-ros2) - A curated list of awesome Robot Operating System Version 2.0 (ROS 2) resources and libraries.
*   [Apollo (‚≠ê26k)](https://github.com/ApolloAuto/apollo) - High performance, flexible architecture which accelerates the development, testing, and deployment of Autonomous Vehicles.
*   [PythonRobotics (‚≠ê25k)](https://github.com/AtsushiSakai/PythonRobotics/) - This is a Python code collection of robotics algorithms, especially for autonomous navigation.
*   [astrobee (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/nasa/astrobee) - Astrobee is a free-flying robot designed to operate as a payload inside the International Space Station (ISS).

### Development Environment / Code and Run

*   [Visual Studio Code (‚≠ê174k)](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode) - Code editor for edit-build-debug cycle.

### Development Environment / Lint and Format

*   [pylint (‚≠ê5.5k)](https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/) - Pylint is a Python static code analysis tool which looks for programming errors, helps enforcing a coding standard, sniffs for code smells and offers simple refactoring suggestions.

### Development Environment / Debugging and Tracing

*   [gdb-frontend (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/rohanrhu/gdb-frontend) - GDBFrontend is an easy, flexible and extensionable gui debugger.
*   [tracy (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/wolfpld/tracy) - A real time, nanosecond resolution, remote telemetry frame profiler for games and other applications.

### Development Environment / Version Control

*   [bfg-repo-cleaner (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/rtyley/bfg-repo-cleaner) - Removes large or troublesome blobs like git-filter-branch does, but faster.

### Simulation / Version Control

*   [Webots (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/cyberbotics/webots) - Webots is an open source robot simulator compatible (among others) with [ROS](http://wiki.ros.org/webots_ros) and [ROS2](http://wiki.ros.org/webots_ros2).
*   [lgsv (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/lgsvl/simulator) - LG Electronics America R\&D Center has developed an HDRP Unity-based multi-robot simulator for autonomous vehicle developers.
*   [awesome-CARLA (‚≠ê858)](https://github.com/Amin-Tgz/awesome-CARLA) - A curated list of awesome CARLA tutorials, blogs, and related projects.
*   [car\_demo (‚≠ê540)](https://github.com/osrf/car_demo) - This is a simulation of a Prius in gazebo 9 with sensor data being published using ROS kinetic.
*   [open-simulation-interface (‚≠ê293)](https://github.com/OpenSimulationInterface/open-simulation-interface) - A generic interface for the environmental perception of automated driving functions in virtual scenarios.

### Electronics and Mechanics / Version Control

*   [phobos (‚≠ê796)](https://github.com/dfki-ric/phobos) - An add-on for Blender allowing to create URDF, SDF and SMURF robot models in a WYSIWYG environment.

### Sensor Processing / Machine Learning

*   [fastai (‚≠ê27k)](https://github.com/fastai/fastai) - The fastai library simplifies training fast and accurate neural nets using modern best practices.
*   [gym (‚≠ê36k)](https://github.com/openai/gym) - A toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement learning algorithms.
*   [tensorflow\_ros\_cpp (‚≠ê59)](https://github.com/tradr-project/tensorflow_ros_cpp) - A ROS package that allows to do Tensorflow inference in C++ without the need to compile TF yourself.

### Sensor Processing / Image Processing

*   [vision\_opencv (‚≠ê609)](https://github.com/ros-perception/vision_opencv) - Packages for interfacing ROS with OpenCV, a library of programming functions for real time computer vision.
*   [tf-pose-estimation](https://github.com/ildoonet/tf-pose-estimation) - Deep Pose Estimation implemented using Tensorflow with Custom Architectures for fast inference.
*   [yolact (‚≠ê5.1k)](https://github.com/dbolya/yolact) - A simple, fully convolutional model for real-time instance segmentation.

### Sensor Processing / Lidar and Point Cloud Processing

*   [point\_cloud\_io (‚≠ê190)](https://github.com/ANYbotics/point_cloud_io) - ROS nodes to read and write point clouds from and to files (e.g. ply, vtk).
*   [robot\_body\_filter (‚≠ê92)](https://github.com/peci1/robot_body_filter) - A highly configurable LaserScan/PointCloud2 filter that allows to dynamically remove the 3D body of the robot from the measurements.
*   [pointcloud\_to\_laserscan (‚≠ê490)](https://github.com/ros-perception/pointcloud_to_laserscan) - Converts a 3D Point Cloud into a 2D laser scan.
*   [PotreeConverter (‚≠ê729)](https://github.com/potree/PotreeConverter) - Builds a potree octree from las, laz, binary ply, xyz or ptx files.
*   [laser\_line\_extraction (‚≠ê420)](https://github.com/kam3k/laser_line_extraction) - A ROS packages that extracts line segments from LaserScan messages.

### Localization and State Estimation / Lidar and Point Cloud Processing

*   [GeographicLib (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/Sciumo/GeographicLib) - A C++ library for geographic projections.
*   [ntripbrowser (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/emlid/ntripbrowser) - A Python API for browsing NTRIP (Networked Transport of RTCM via Internet Protocol).
*   [imu\_tools (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/ccny-ros-pkg/imu_tools) - IMU-related filters and visualizers.

### Simultaneous Localization and Mapping / Lidar

*   [loam\_velodyne (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/laboshinl/loam_velodyne) - Laser Odometry and Mapping (Loam) is a realtime method for state estimation and mapping using a 3D lidar.
*   [maplab (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/ethz-asl/maplab) - An open visual-inertial mapping framework.
*   [interactive\_slam (‚≠ê899)](https://github.com/SMRT-AIST/interactive_slam) -  In contrast to existing automatic SLAM packages, we with minimal human effort.

### Simultaneous Localization and Mapping / Visual

*   [LARVIO (‚≠ê764)](https://github.com/PetWorm/LARVIO) - A lightweight, accurate and robust monocular visual inertial odometry based on Multi-State Constraint Kalman Filter.
*   [fiducials (‚≠ê274)](https://github.com/UbiquityRobotics/fiducials) - Simultaneous localization and mapping using fiducial markers.

### Behavior and Decision / Vector Map

*   [py\_trees\_ros (‚≠ê191)](https://github.com/splintered-reality/py_trees_ros) - Behaviours, trees and utilities that extend py\_trees for use with ROS.

### Planning and Control / Vector Map

*   [HypridAStarTrailer](https://github.com/AtsushiSakai/HybridAStarTrailer) - A path planning algorithm based on Hybrid A\* for trailer truck.
*   [open\_street\_map (‚≠ê84)](https://github.com/ros-geographic-info/open_street_map) - ROS packages for working with Open Street Map geographic information.
*   [fastrack (‚≠ê76)](https://github.com/HJReachability/fastrack) - A ROS implementation of Fast and Safe Tracking (FaSTrack).
*   [traffic-editor (‚≠ê150)](https://github.com/osrf/traffic-editor) - A graphical editor for robot traffic flows.
*   [openrave (‚≠ê772)](https://github.com/rdiankov/openrave) - Open Robotics Automation Virtual Environment: An environment for testing, developing, and deploying robotics motion planning algorithms.

### User Interaction / Graphical User Interface

*   [cage (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/Hjdskes/cage) - This is Cage, a Wayland kiosk. A kiosk runs a single, maximized application.
*   [pencil (‚≠ê9.2k)](https://github.com/evolus/pencil) - A tool for making diagrams and GUI prototyping that everyone can use.

### User Interaction / Command Line Interface

*   [ag (‚≠ê27k)](https://github.com/ggreer/the_silver_searcher) - A code-searching tool similar to ack, but faster.
*   [pkgtop (‚≠ê328)](https://github.com/orhun/pkgtop) - Interactive package manager and resource monitor designed for the GNU/Linux.
*   [gocui (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/jroimartin/gocui) - Minimalist Go package aimed at creating Console User Interfaces.
*   [bat (‚≠ê53k)](https://github.com/sharkdp/bat) - A cat(1) clone with wings.

### Data Visualization and Mission Control / Command Line Interface

*   [Pangolin (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/stevenlovegrove/Pangolin) - Pangolin is a lightweight portable rapid development library for managing OpenGL display / interaction and abstracting video input.
*   [streetscape.gl (‚≠ê955)](https://github.com/uber/streetscape.gl) - Streetscape.gl is a toolkit for visualizing autonomous and robotics data in the XVIZ protocol.

### Data Visualization and Mission Control / Point Cloud

*   [CloudCompare (‚≠ê4k)](https://github.com/CloudCompare/CloudCompare) - CloudCompare is a 3D point cloud (and triangular mesh) processing software.

### Data Visualization and Mission Control / RViz

*   [mapviz (‚≠ê437)](https://github.com/swri-robotics/mapviz) - Modular ROS visualization tool for 2D data.
*   [rviz\_cinematographer (‚≠ê245)](https://github.com/AIS-Bonn/rviz_cinematographer) - Easy to use tools to create and edit trajectories for the rviz camera.

### Operation System / Database and Record

*   [nextcloud (‚≠ê30k)](https://github.com/nextcloud/server) - Nextcloud is a suite of client-server software for creating and using file hosting services.

### Operation System / Server Infrastructure and High Performance Computing

*   [polyaxon (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/polyaxon/polyaxon) - A platform for reproducing and managing the whole life cycle of machine learning and deep learning applications.
*   [enroot (‚≠ê788)](https://github.com/NVIDIA/enroot) - A simple, yet powerful tool to turn traditional container/OS images into unprivileged sandboxes.

### Network and Middleware / Real-Time Kernel

*   [realtime\_support (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/ros2/realtime_support) - Minimal real-time testing utility for measuring jitter and latency.

### Security / Sensor and Acuator Interfaces

*   [How-to-Secure-A-Linux-Server (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/imthenachoman/How-To-Secure-A-Linux-Server) - An evolving how-to guide for securing a Linux server.
*   [brutespray (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/x90skysn3k/brutespray) - Automatically attempts default creds on found services.
*   [hardening (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/konstruktoid/hardening) - A quick way to make a Ubuntu server a bit more secure.

### Datasets / Sensor and Acuator Interfaces

*   [dataset-api (‚≠ê597)](https://github.com/ApolloScapeAuto/dataset-api) - This is a repo of toolkit for ApolloScape Dataset, CVPR 2019 Workshop on Autonomous Driving Challenge and ECCV 2018 challenge.
items.content_html:
Documentation and Presentation

  • Reveal-Hugo (‚≠ê720) - A Hugo theme for Reveal.js that makes authoring and customization a breeze. With it, you can turn any properly-formatted Hugo content into a HTML presentation.
  • Hugo-Webslides (‚≠ê131) - This is a Hugo template to create WebSlides presentation using markdown.

Requirements and Safety

  • awesome-safety-critical (‚≠ê1.6k) - List of resources about programming practices for writing safety-critical software.

Frameworks and Stacks

  • awesome-ros2 (‚≠ê1.9k) - A curated list of awesome Robot Operating System Version 2.0 (ROS 2) resources and libraries.
  • Apollo (‚≠ê26k) - High performance, flexible architecture which accelerates the development, testing, and deployment of Autonomous Vehicles.
  • PythonRobotics (‚≠ê25k) - This is a Python code collection of robotics algorithms, especially for autonomous navigation.
  • astrobee (‚≠ê1.2k) - Astrobee is a free-flying robot designed to operate as a payload inside the International Space Station (ISS).

Development Environment / Code and Run

  • Visual Studio Code (‚≠ê174k) - Code editor for edit-build-debug cycle.

Development Environment / Lint and Format

  • pylint (‚≠ê5.5k) - Pylint is a Python static code analysis tool which looks for programming errors, helps enforcing a coding standard, sniffs for code smells and offers simple refactoring suggestions.

Development Environment / Debugging and Tracing

  • gdb-frontend (‚≠ê2.9k) - GDBFrontend is an easy, flexible and extensionable gui debugger.
  • tracy (‚≠ê12k) - A real time, nanosecond resolution, remote telemetry frame profiler for games and other applications.

Development Environment / Version Control

  • bfg-repo-cleaner (‚≠ê12k) - Removes large or troublesome blobs like git-filter-branch does, but faster.

Simulation / Version Control

  • Webots (‚≠ê3.7k) - Webots is an open source robot simulator compatible (among others) with ROS and ROS2.
  • lgsv (‚≠ê2.4k) - LG Electronics America R&D Center has developed an HDRP Unity-based multi-robot simulator for autonomous vehicle developers.
  • awesome-CARLA (‚≠ê858) - A curated list of awesome CARLA tutorials, blogs, and related projects.
  • car_demo (‚≠ê540) - This is a simulation of a Prius in gazebo 9 with sensor data being published using ROS kinetic.
  • open-simulation-interface (‚≠ê293) - A generic interface for the environmental perception of automated driving functions in virtual scenarios.

Electronics and Mechanics / Version Control

  • phobos (‚≠ê796) - An add-on for Blender allowing to create URDF, SDF and SMURF robot models in a WYSIWYG environment.

Sensor Processing / Machine Learning

  • fastai (‚≠ê27k) - The fastai library simplifies training fast and accurate neural nets using modern best practices.
  • gym (‚≠ê36k) - A toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement learning algorithms.
  • tensorflow_ros_cpp (‚≠ê59) - A ROS package that allows to do Tensorflow inference in C++ without the need to compile TF yourself.

Sensor Processing / Image Processing

  • vision_opencv (‚≠ê609) - Packages for interfacing ROS with OpenCV, a library of programming functions for real time computer vision.
  • tf-pose-estimation - Deep Pose Estimation implemented using Tensorflow with Custom Architectures for fast inference.
  • yolact (‚≠ê5.1k) - A simple, fully convolutional model for real-time instance segmentation.

Sensor Processing / Lidar and Point Cloud Processing

  • point_cloud_io (‚≠ê190) - ROS nodes to read and write point clouds from and to files (e.g. ply, vtk).
  • robot_body_filter (‚≠ê92) - A highly configurable LaserScan/PointCloud2 filter that allows to dynamically remove the 3D body of the robot from the measurements.
  • pointcloud_to_laserscan (‚≠ê490) - Converts a 3D Point Cloud into a 2D laser scan.
  • PotreeConverter (‚≠ê729) - Builds a potree octree from las, laz, binary ply, xyz or ptx files.
  • laser_line_extraction (‚≠ê420) - A ROS packages that extracts line segments from LaserScan messages.

Localization and State Estimation / Lidar and Point Cloud Processing

  • GeographicLib (‚≠ê38) - A C++ library for geographic projections.
  • ntripbrowser (‚≠ê33) - A Python API for browsing NTRIP (Networked Transport of RTCM via Internet Protocol).
  • imu_tools (‚≠ê1k) - IMU-related filters and visualizers.

Simultaneous Localization and Mapping / Lidar

  • loam_velodyne (‚≠ê1.7k) - Laser Odometry and Mapping (Loam) is a realtime method for state estimation and mapping using a 3D lidar.
  • maplab (‚≠ê2.7k) - An open visual-inertial mapping framework.
  • interactive_slam (‚≠ê899) - In contrast to existing automatic SLAM packages, we with minimal human effort.

Simultaneous Localization and Mapping / Visual

  • LARVIO (‚≠ê764) - A lightweight, accurate and robust monocular visual inertial odometry based on Multi-State Constraint Kalman Filter.
  • fiducials (‚≠ê274) - Simultaneous localization and mapping using fiducial markers.

Behavior and Decision / Vector Map

  • py_trees_ros (‚≠ê191) - Behaviours, trees and utilities that extend py_trees for use with ROS.

Planning and Control / Vector Map

  • HypridAStarTrailer - A path planning algorithm based on Hybrid A* for trailer truck.
  • open_street_map (‚≠ê84) - ROS packages for working with Open Street Map geographic information.
  • fastrack (‚≠ê76) - A ROS implementation of Fast and Safe Tracking (FaSTrack).
  • traffic-editor (‚≠ê150) - A graphical editor for robot traffic flows.
  • openrave (‚≠ê772) - Open Robotics Automation Virtual Environment: An environment for testing, developing, and deploying robotics motion planning algorithms.

User Interaction / Graphical User Interface

  • cage (‚≠ê1.5k) - This is Cage, a Wayland kiosk. A kiosk runs a single, maximized application.
  • pencil (‚≠ê9.2k) - A tool for making diagrams and GUI prototyping that everyone can use.

User Interaction / Command Line Interface

  • ag (‚≠ê27k) - A code-searching tool similar to ack, but faster.
  • pkgtop (‚≠ê328) - Interactive package manager and resource monitor designed for the GNU/Linux.
  • gocui (‚≠ê10k) - Minimalist Go package aimed at creating Console User Interfaces.
  • bat (‚≠ê53k) - A cat(1) clone with wings.

Data Visualization and Mission Control / Command Line Interface

  • Pangolin (‚≠ê2.6k) - Pangolin is a lightweight portable rapid development library for managing OpenGL display / interaction and abstracting video input.
  • streetscape.gl (‚≠ê955) - Streetscape.gl is a toolkit for visualizing autonomous and robotics data in the XVIZ protocol.

Data Visualization and Mission Control / Point Cloud

  • CloudCompare (‚≠ê4k) - CloudCompare is a 3D point cloud (and triangular mesh) processing software.

Data Visualization and Mission Control / RViz

  • mapviz (‚≠ê437) - Modular ROS visualization tool for 2D data.
  • rviz_cinematographer (‚≠ê245) - Easy to use tools to create and edit trajectories for the rviz camera.

Operation System / Database and Record

  • nextcloud (‚≠ê30k) - Nextcloud is a suite of client-server software for creating and using file hosting services.

Operation System / Server Infrastructure and High Performance Computing

  • polyaxon (‚≠ê3.7k) - A platform for reproducing and managing the whole life cycle of machine learning and deep learning applications.
  • enroot (‚≠ê788) - A simple, yet powerful tool to turn traditional container/OS images into unprivileged sandboxes.

Network and Middleware / Real-Time Kernel

  • realtime_support (‚≠ê69) - Minimal real-time testing utility for measuring jitter and latency.

Security / Sensor and Acuator Interfaces

  • How-to-Secure-A-Linux-Server (‚≠ê18k) - An evolving how-to guide for securing a Linux server.
  • brutespray (‚≠ê2.3k) - Automatically attempts default creds on found services.
  • hardening (‚≠ê1.5k) - A quick way to make a Ubuntu server a bit more secure.

Datasets / Sensor and Acuator Interfaces

  • dataset-api (‚≠ê597) - This is a repo of toolkit for ApolloScape Dataset, CVPR 2019 Workshop on Autonomous Driving Challenge and ECCV 2018 challenge.

items.title: Awesome Fuzzing
items.content_text:
### Papers / IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy (IEEE S&P)

*   [Fuzzing JavaScript Engines with Aspect-preserving Mutation, 2020](https://jakkdu.github.io/pubs/2020/park:die.pdf)
*   [IJON: Exploring Deep State Spaces via Fuzzing, 2020](https://www.syssec.ruhr-uni-bochum.de/media/emma/veroeffentlichungen/2020/02/27/IJON-Oakland20.pdf)
*   [Krace: Data Race Fuzzing for Kernel File Systems, 2020](https://www.cc.gatech.edu/~mxu80/pubs/xu:krace.pdf)
*   [Pangolin:Incremental Hybrid Fuzzing with Polyhedral Path Abstraction, 2020](https://qingkaishi.github.io/public_pdfs/SP2020.pdf)
*   [RetroWrite: Statically Instrumenting COTS Binaries for Fuzzing and Sanitization, 2020](https://www.semanticscholar.org/paper/RetroWrite%3A-Statically-Instrumenting-COTS-Binaries-Dinesh-Burow/845cafb153b0e4b9943c6d9b6a7e42c14845a0d6)
